metadata.title: CVE-2023-1192 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in smb2_is_status_io_timeout() in CIFS inthe Linux Kernel. After CIFS transfers response data to a system call,there are still local variable points to the memory region, and if thesystem call frees it faster than CIFS uses it, CIFS will access a freememory region, leading to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
